page.title: 18A Parish Priest in Solihull
page.content: Our Parish Priest has been a priest for 36 years and parish priest of{Our Lady of the Wayside}in Shirley since 1962. He moved from England to Ireland because he felt he would be more of a missionary. In Ireland 98% of the people are Catholic but in England they are a minority of only 5 million. Our priest has become well known throughout many countries of the world due to the vast amount of aid which he has sent to the Third World. During the year leading up to July 1985 he has sent over Â£500,000 in medicines to poor countries. To Ghana he sent medicines and equipment valued at Â£17,866; to Madagascar Â£50,000 and to Ethiopia Â£30,000. For the Â£26,000 aid he sent to Poland he was awarded the {Polish Gold Cross}which had not been awarded for 50 years. (Cont.)
